titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Benjamin Garlinger papers, 1819-1895

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection consists of business and personal letters and legal documents relating to Benjamin Garlinger, Sr. The legal documents include land deeds for Maryland.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Benjamin Garlinger Papers, 1819-1895, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Benjamin A. Garlinger was an active public official in Hagerstown, Maryland, in the mid-19th century. Appointments included sheriff (1855), tax collector (1862-1863), and school commissioner (1872-1880).

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of business and personal letters and legal documents relating to Benjamin Garlinger, Sr. The legal documents include land deeds for Maryland.
